grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 淡々【タンタン】uninterested, unconcerned, indifferent, dispassionate, matter-of-fact, detached, plain, light, simple, bland, flowing gently
淡水【タンスイ】fresh water (i.e. not salt water)
濃淡【ノウタン】light and shade, shade (of colour, color), depth (of flavor), complexity, strength and weakness (of flavor)
kun reading compounds: 淡い【あわい】light, faint, pale, fleeting
淡い悲しみ【あわいかなしみ】fleeting sorrow
